tr_quotes.quote: Öfke her zaman hüsranla sonuçlanan beklentilerden gelir.
tr_quotes.author: Elliott Larson

tr_quotes.quote: Başkaları ile ilgili canımızı sıkan her şey kendimizi daha iyi anlamamıza yardımcı olabilir.
tr_quotes.author: Carl Jung

tr_quotes.quote: Bu dünyadaki en önemli şey sevgiyi yaymayı öğrenmek ve gelmesine izin vermektir.
tr_quotes.author: Morrie Schwartz

tr_quotes.quote: Yarı doğrudan çekinin. Yanlış yarısına sahip olmuş olabilirsiniz.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Bir anlık kızgınlıkta sabırlı olursanız yüz günlük pişmanlıktan kurtulursunuz.
tr_quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

tr_quotes.quote: Başkalarının ne yaptığına veya yapmadığına dikkat etmek yerine, ne yapıp yapmadığınıza dikkat edin.
tr_quotes.author: Dhammapada

tr_quotes.quote: Eğer bir insandan nefret ediyorsan, Onun içinde sana ait olan bir parçadan nefret ediyorsun demektir.
tr_quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke gelince, akıl uçup gider.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Hiddet ekilen yerden, pişmanlık biçilir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeyi besleyen, yine öfkedir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke, bedene güç verse de ruhu gevşetir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Sabırlı insanın, öfkesinden sakının.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke, aklın alevini söndüren büyük bir rüzgârdır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeli bir insan, ağzını açar gözlerini kapar.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Hiçbir şey öfke kadar, insan düşüncesini sapıtamaz.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkenin başlangıcı çılgınlık, sonu pişmanlıktır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeli bir insanı susturmak istiyorsanız, önce siz susunuz.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kızgınlık, insanın lambasını söndüren bir rüzgârdır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Arkadaşına öfkeni söyle geçsin, düşmanına söyle artsın.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeyle geçen bir dakikanız, mutluluğunuzdan çalınmış altmış saniyedir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Zorluklara karşı kızmak, onu yenemeyeceğinizi anlamak demektir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke ateşi önce sahibini yakar, sonra kıvılcımı düşmana ya varır ya varmaz.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke geçici bir çılgınlıktır, hükmetmeye bak yoksa o sana hükmeder.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Sevinçli anında kimseye vaatte bulunma, öfkeli anında kimseye cevap verme.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kızgınken karar veren, fırtınalı havada yelken açan bir insan gibidir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke insanı atılgan kılabilirse de gücünü, insanın kendisini sevmesinden alır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Hiçbir zaman çıktığın kapıyı hızla çarpma, geri dönmek isteyebilirsin.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: İnsanın kızması, başkalarının hatalarının intikamını kendinden alması demektir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Sinirli olunduğu zaman her şey sabrı taşırıyor, incitiyor, ateşi yükseltiyor.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeliyken konuş, göreceksin ki pişman olacağın en güzel konuşmayı yapacaksın.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkenin her zaman bir nedeni vardır; ama her zaman iyi bir nedeni yoktur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfken ve nefsin bir olup aklını yener. Daima sabırlı, sebatlı ve iradene sahip olasın.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Hiddet, bulunduğu kaba döküldüğü yerden daha çok zarar veren bir asittir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Tartışmalarda öfkelendiğimiz an gerçek için değil, kendi hesabımıza çalışmaya başlarız.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: İki şiddetli yangın karşılaşıp birleşince, onları kızdıran şeyi de yakıp tüketirler.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkeyle sarılmak, birine atmak için kavradığınız sıcak bir kömür parçası gibidir; yanan aslında sizsinizdir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kuvvetli kimse demek, güreşte başkalarını yenen değil; ancak hiddet anında kendine hâkim olandır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfkelenmek beşeri bir olaydır; fakat bilahare sakinleşmemek ve affetmemek, ayıplanacak iğrenç bir harekettir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Hiçbir kul, bir öfke yudumunu yutması kadar kendisine yararlı bir süt veya bal yudumu yutmamıştır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke ve kin, doğruluğun sınırları dışındadır. Bu tutkular, yalnız işlerine akıllarıyla bağlanmayan insanların işine yarar.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kim bağışlarsa Allah da onu bağışlar, kim affederse Allah da onu affeder. Kim öfkesini yutarsa Allah onu mükâfatlandırır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Öfke, tutuşturulmuş bir ateş gibidir. Her kim ki öfkesine hâkim olursa, onu söndürür. Ve her kim onu salıverirse, ilk yanan kendisi olur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Her insan öfkelenir bu kolaydır; fakat doğru insana, tam ölçüsünde, tam zamanında, tam yerinde ve tam usulünde öfkelenmek, ne herkesin kudretindedir ne de kolaydır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

en_quotes.quote: Anger always comes from expectations that result in disappointment.
en_quotes.author: Elliott Larson

en_quotes.quote: Anything that bothers us about others can help us better understand ourselves.
en_quotes.author: Carl Jung

en_quotes.quote: The most important thing in this world is to learn to spread love and let it come.
en_quotes.author: Morrie Schwartz

en_quotes.quote: Make a semi direct check. You may have had the wrong half.
Never apologize for showing your feelings. By doing so, you apologize for the truth.
en_quotes.author: Benjamin disraeli

en_quotes.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the property of the powerful.
en_quotes.author: Mahatma gandhi

en_quotes.quote: What makes a person strong is not holding as some people think, but sometimes letting go.
There is only one freedom I know of, and that is the freedom of mind.
en_quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

en_quotes.quote: You cannot force yourself into something that you do not feel, but you can do the right thing in spite of your feelings.
en_quotes.author: Pearl S. Buck

en_quotes.quote: The biggest obstacle to our joy is resentment.
en_quotes.author: Pema Chodron

en_quotes.quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Hope is the feeling that the feeling you have is not permanent.
en_quotes.author: Joan Kerr

en_quotes.quote: Complaining is stupid. Either act or forget.
en_quotes.author: Stefan Sagmeister

en_quotes.quote: Every sixty seconds you spend in anger, anger, or going insane is a whole minute of happiness that you can never bring back.
The biggest problem for humanity, not only at the global level but also individually, is misunderstanding.
en_quotes.author: Rinpoche

en_quotes.quote: Pay attention to what you are doing and not doing instead of paying attention to what others are doing or not doing.
en_quotes.author: Dhammapada

en_quotes.quote: Remembering a mistake is like carrying a burden in your mind.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you were.
en_quotes.author: Chérie Carter-Scott

en_quotes.quote: Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering.
en_quotes.author: Yoda

en_quotes.quote: Do not let your anger lead to hatred, as you will hurt yourself more than you would the other.
en_quotes.author: Stephen Richards

en_quotes.quote: I lose my temper, but it's all over in a minute,' said the student. 'So is the hydrogen bomb,' I replied. 'But think of the damage it produces!
en_quotes.author: George Sweeting

en_quotes.quote: There's nothing wrong with anger provided you use it constructively.
en_quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

en_quotes.quote: The best fighter is never angry.
en_quotes.author: Lao Tzu

en_quotes.quote: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

en_quotes.quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it... Don't allow his anger to become your anger.
en_quotes.author: Bohdi Sanders

en_quotes.quote: Anger is stupid, and stupidity will kill you more surely than your opponent's blade.
en_quotes.author: Patricia Briggs

en_quotes.quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Anger always comes from frustrated expectations.
en_quotes.author: Elliott Larson

en_quotes.quote: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Kempis

en_quotes.quote: The fiercest anger of all, the most incurable, is that which rages in the place of dearest love.
en_quotes.author: Euripides

en_quotes.quote: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses.
en_quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

en_quotes.quote: Speak when you are angry and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.
en_quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

en_quotes.quote: Most misunderstandings in the world could be avoided if people would simply take the time to ask, 'What else could this mean?
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: Anger blows out the lamp of the mind.
en_quotes.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

en_quotes.quote: Bitterness is like cancer. It eats upon the host. But anger is like fire. It burns it all clean.
en_quotes.author: Maya Angelou

en_quotes.quote: For every minute you are angry, you lose 60 seconds of happiness.
en_quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en_quotes.quote: Angry people are not always wise.
en_quotes.author: Jane Austen

en_quotes.quote: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.
en_quotes.author: George Eliot

en_quotes.quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
en_quotes.author: Mark Twain

en_quotes.quote: A man is about as big as the things that make him angry.
en_quotes.author: Winston Churchill

en_quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Paine

en_quotes.quote: Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.
en_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

en_quotes.quote: Holding on to anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a bad counselor.
en_quotes.author: French Proverb

en_quotes.quote: When you want to become free, your righteousness and anger are much less interesting than they used to be.
en_quotes.author: Ram Dass

en_quotes.quote: People won't have time for you if you are always angry or complaining.
en_quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

en_quotes.quote: Don't hold to anger, hurt or pain. They steal your energy and keep you from love.
en_quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

en_quotes.quote: Calm is the best revenge.
en_quotes.author: Bangambiki Habyarimana

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a boomerang.
en_quotes.author: Karen Salmansohn

en_quotes.quote: Anger makes us feel so isolated.
en_quotes.author: Fred Rogers

en_quotes.quote: Free your hearts of anxiety, pain and anger, to have peace within your heart and soul.
en_quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

en_quotes.quote: The smarter you get, the more you realize anger is not worth it.
en_quotes.author: Maxime Lagacé

en_quotes.quote: Patience and empathy are anger's mortal enemies.
en_quotes.author: Gary Rudz

en_quotes.quote: Getting angry in a stressful situation is like trying to clean something with dirt.
en_quotes.author: Urbanky Aurel Petru

en_quotes.quote: Not being outraged by anything is a superpower.
en_quotes.author: James Pierce

en_quotes.quote: You are not the anger, you are the awareness behind the anger. Realize this and the anger will no longer control you.
en_quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

en_quotes.quote: You can't selectively numb your anger, any more than you can turn off all lights in a room, and still expect to see the light.
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: If you hate a person, then you're defeated by them.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: If it comes, let it come. If it goes, it's ok, let it go. Let things come and go. Stay calm, don't let anything disturb your peace, and carry on.
en_quotes.author: Germany Kent

en_quotes.quote: Never do anything when you are in a temper, for you will do everything wrong.
en_quotes.author: Baltasar Gracian

en_quotes.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
en_quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

en_quotes.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
en_quotes.author: Roy T. Bennett

en_quotes.quote: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
en_quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

en_quotes.quote: Anybody can become angry – that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way – that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
en_quotes.author: Aristotle

en_quotes.quote: People won't have time for you if you are always angry or complaining.
en_quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

en_quotes.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So, let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.
en_quotes.author: Jack Layton

en_quotes.quote: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
en_quotes.author: James Thurber

en_quotes.quote: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
en_quotes.author: Mark Twain

en_quotes.quote: The opposite of anger is not calmness, its empathy.
en_quotes.author: Mehmet Oz

en_quotes.quote: Boredom, anger, sadness, or fear are not 'yours,' not personal. They are conditions of the human mind. They come and go. Nothing that comes and goes is you.
en_quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

en_quotes.quote: Generally speaking, if a human being never shows anger, then I think something's wrong. He's not right in the brain.
en_quotes.author: Dalai Lama

en_quotes.quote: Meditation can help us embrace our worries, our fear, our anger; and that is very healing. We let our own natural capacity of healing do the work.
en_quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

en_quotes.quote: I was very fortunate to play sports. All the anger in me went out. I had to do what I had to do. If you stay angry all the time, then you really don't have a good life.
en_quotes.author: Willie Mays

en_quotes.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people; to focus your energies on answers - not excuses.
en_quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

en_quotes.quote: You reclaim your power by loving what you were once taught to hate.
en_quotes.author: Bryant H. McGill

en_quotes.quote: The best remedy for a short temper is a long walk.
en_quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

en_quotes.quote: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness. When you feel it coming, turn your focus to your breath.
en_quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

en_quotes.quote: As far as having peace within myself, the one way I can do that is forgiving the people who have done wrong to me. It causes more stress to build up anger. Peace is more productive.
en_quotes.author: Rodney King

en_quotes.quote: When you hold on to anger and unforgiveness, you can't move forward.
en_quotes.author: Mary J. Blige

en_quotes.quote: If anger proceeds from a great cause, it turns to fury; if from a small cause, it is peevishness; and so is always either terrible or ridiculous.
en_quotes.author: eremy Taylor

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
en_quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

en_quotes.quote: The more anger towards the past you carry in your heart, the less capable you are of loving in the present.
en_quotes.author: Barbara De Angelis

en_quotes.quote: When you assume negative intent, you're angry. If you take away that anger and assume positive intent, you will be amazed. Your emotional quotient goes up because you are no longer almost random in your response.
en_quotes.author: Indra Nooyi

en_quotes.quote: In Israel, waves of anger and fear circulate all the time, but so do jokes and gossip and silky evening breezes. So, too, in America.
en_quotes.author: P.J. O'Rourke

en_quotes.quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that four of his fingers are pointing at himself.
en_quotes.author: Louis Nizer

en_quotes.quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
en_quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

en_quotes.quote: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
en_quotes.author: Plato

en_quotes.quote: When we can lay down our fear and anger and choose responses other than aggression, we create the conditions for bringing out the best in us humans.
en_quotes.author: Margaret J. Wheatley

en_quotes.quote: Anger resolves nothing it only puts up your blood pressure.
en_quotes.author: Catherine Pulsifer

en_quotes.quote: To be angry is to let others' mistakes punish yourself.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: I lose my temper, but it's all over in a minute," said the student. "So is the hydrogen bomb," I replied. "But think of the damage it produces!
en_quotes.author: George Sweeting

en_quotes.quote: Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering.
en_quotes.author: Yoda

en_quotes.quote: I was angered, for I had no shoes. Then I met a man who had no feet.
en_quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

en_quotes.quote: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
en_quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

en_quotes.quote: It's you, from the dawn to nighttime; you when the day is fair, you when the storm is raging - how do you face despair?
en_quotes.author: Edgar A Guest

en_quotes.quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.
en_quotes.author: Jack Layton

en_quotes.quote: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love
en_quotes.author: George Eliot

en_quotes.quote: Anger blows out the lamp of the mind.
en_quotes.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

en_quotes.quote: Whether we like to admit it or not, those of us who struggle with an unforgiving heart also carry around a tremendous amount of anger.
en_quotes.author: Brian Jones

en_quotes.quote: Anger is the emotion preeminently serviceable for the display of power.
en_quotes.author: Walter B. Cannon

en_quotes.quote: Anger expressed in a healthy and positive way means that we channel emotional anger towards resolution not attack.
en_quotes.author: Byron R. Pulsifer

en_quotes.quote: But the day is a steady drain of small annoyances, and the difference in the size of men becomes hourly more apparent. The little man loses his temper; the big man takes a firmer hold.
en_quotes.author: Bruce Barton

en_quotes.quote: Let not the sun go down upon your anger. Anger must be limited and confined, both in race and in time.
en_quotes.author: Francis Bacon

en_quotes.quote: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame
en_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

en_quotes.quote: Anger can be an expensive luxury.
en_quotes.author: Italian Proverb

en_quotes.quote: When we are caught up in a destructive emotion, we lose one of our greatest assets: our independence
en_quotes.author: Dalai Lama

en_quotes.quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
en_quotes.author: Confucius

en_quotes.quote: A quick temper will make a fool of you soon enough.
en_quotes.author: Bruce Lee

en_quotes.quote: Great anger and violence can never build a nation.
en_quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

en_quotes.quote: Speak the truth, do not become angered, and give when asked, even be it a little.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Anger at oneself is a destructive thing.
en_quotes.author: Qui-Gon Jinn

en_quotes.quote: For some people, feelings of anger can be quite frightening, so they seek to suppress these emotions in order to avoid conflict.
en_quotes.author: Paul Gilbert

en_quotes.quote: Controlling anger is a personalized exercise. What works for me may not work for you. You need to find what makes you angry.
en_quotes.author: Q. C. Aaron

en_quotes.quote: Anger is never without reason, but seldom with a good one.
en_quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

en_quotes.quote: Explosive anger can really hurt your relationships with your spouse, kids, family, and friends. It causes lasting scars in the people you love most, and it can get in the way of resolving conflicts.
en_quotes.author: Roldan

en_quotes.quote: Self control refers to controlling one's emotions and feelings and not losing one's cool even in the worst of situations.
en_quotes.author: Brian Adams

en_quotes.quote: The best time for you to hold your tongue is the time you feel you must say something or bust.
en_quotes.author: Josh Billings

en_quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
en_quotes.author: Seneca

en_quotes.quote: An important key in anger management is identifying the trigger and what it means for you.
en_quotes.author: Daniel Brush

en_quotes.quote: The more anger towards the past you carry in your heart, the less capable you are of loving in the present.
en_quotes.author: Barbara de Angelis

en_quotes.quote: Put all hatred and anger aside for you will not reach the truth unless you reach for the loving spirit that resides within you.
en_quotes.author: M. Lee

en_quotes.quote: Anger that is getting the way of happiness needs decluttering. Begin by refusing to blame others for your moods.
en_quotes.author: Julianne Neilson

en_quotes.quote: The development of genuine, open-minded patience may very well lead one to also examine one's experience of anger and its root causes.
en_quotes.author: Allan Lokos

en_quotes.quote: No matter what type of anger or frustration we have to struggle with, ... a clear picture of how our faith in God is the answer to anything we need to overcome.
en_quotes.author: Carol Graham

en_quotes.quote: I heard from marriage and family counselors, who agreed that the... problem is getting couples not to 'express' anger, but to shut up long enough to listen to each other.
en_quotes.author: Carol Tavris

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a bad advisor.
en_quotes.author: Czech Proverb

en_quotes.quote: Anger is our unconsciousness's fastest way to let us know that our boundaries are being stepped on.
en_quotes.author: Wendy Hammond

en_quotes.quote: When true forgiveness takes place in our hearts, the only thing that is removed is our resentment and anger toward the offender concerning the transgression that caused the pain.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Bear

en_quotes.quote: Thoughts that are powered by fear will cause feelings of anxiety, anger or frustration, which will manifest into your life and create negative or bad experiences.
en_quotes.author: Joe Hinchliffe

en_quotes.quote: Death has a way of making our feel violated, as if someone stole something from you. In many cases anger occurs while grieving, but there may not be anyone to blame for your loss.
en_quotes.author: Marita Kinney

en_quotes.quote: Identifying the true root causes of your anger can take a lot of courage. No one likes to admit that they are responsible for their own negative behaviors.
en_quotes.author: Philip Johnson

en_quotes.quote: It is serious, and you won't get control of your anger unless you mean business about sorting this difficulty out, once and for all. You will need to be committed to change, but, it can be done.
en_quotes.author: John Crawford

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a feeling that we need to control, we need to step back from it and think before we react.
en_quotes.author: Catherine Pulsifer

en_quotes.quote: Anger worsens any situation for you, whomever you're angry with, and the relationship between you and them.
en_quotes.author: Marge Powers

en_quotes.quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Although anger is a natural emotion that we all experience, you should never let it control you.
en_quotes.author: Alexis G. Roldan

en_quotes.quote: People who are passive aggressive don't express their anger directly. Rather, they have the tendency to become sarcastic, stubborn or procrastinate things.
en_quotes.author: Malcom Rockwood

en_quotes.quote: Chances are someone has hurt you really bad and the only way you will be free from the anger is to forgive them.
en_quotes.author: James Robor

en_quotes.quote: Being compassionate helps with anger and resolves bitterness more easily than anything.
en_quotes.author: Brittany Hallison

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a sick, negative energy that will suck out everything positive in your life. Literally nothing positive comes from anger.
en_quotes.author: Arielle Tepite

en_quotes.quote: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
en_quotes.author: Francis Bacon

en_quotes.quote: The problem is not anger; the problem is that we don't understand what to do with the feeling of anger, or understand what is underlying that feeling.
en_quotes.author: Deborah Rozman

en_quotes.quote: A gentle answer deflects anger, but harsh words make tempers flare.
en_quotes.author: Proverbs

en_quotes.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one getting burned.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: If you ever react with anger, it will overtake you. You will say something or do something you regret.
en_quotes.author: Rhonda Hart

en_quotes.quote: Anger is the most impotent of passions. It effects nothing it goes about, and hurts the one who is possessed by it more than the one against whom it is directed.
en_quotes.author: Clarendon

en_quotes.quote: Hurt can turn to anger, anger to rage, and good people can go bad very quickly if lead on this destructive path.
en_quotes.author: Paul Brodie

en_quotes.quote: Anger is a powerful thing and if you don't know how to get to the root of it, you'll never overcome it.
en_quotes.author: Paul Kendall
